channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world

item.title: Unidentified remains of 3 people transferred to Israel, Red Cross says
item.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — The Red Cross said it transferred the unidentified remains of three people to Israel late Friday but they were still being examined and may not be those of missing hostages, an Israeli military official said.
item.dc:creator: WAFAA SHURAFA and JULIA FRANKEL, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Trump won't send 'high level' representatives to COP30 climate summit
item.description: The U.S. won’t be sending any “high level” representatives to this year’s United Nations climate summit, a White House official told The Hill on Friday. The summit, known as COP30, will be held in Brazil next month.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Frazin, The Hill

item.title: Andrew, the civilian formerly known as 'prince,' faces an uncertain future
item.description: LONDON (AP) — He has lost his title as prince, lost his rent-free mansion on the sprawling grounds next to Windsor Castle and lost whatever remained of his reputation in the public eye.
item.dc:creator: BRIAN MELLEY, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Militia attack on hospital in Darfur came in waves, WHO says
item.description: The World Health Organization reports that gunmen who reportedly killed at least 460 people at a hospital in Sudan's Darfur region returned three times to the facility during their assault.
item.dc:creator: Jamey Keaten And Sarah El Deeb, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: Prince Andrew moves to Sandringham
item.description: Unlike other properties that the royal family inhabits through the Crown Estate, Sandringham is privately owned by the king.
item.dc:creator: Teddy Grant, NewsNation

item.title: Built in the shadows and launched at night, Ukraine's long-range drones are rattling Russia
item.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — At a secret location in rural Ukraine, columns of attack drones are assembled at night and in near silence to strike deep inside Russia. Their targets are strategic: oil refineries, fuel depots, and military logistics hubs.
item.dc:creator: DEREK GATOPOULOS and VOLODYMYR YURCHUK, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: Orbán to press Trump for Hungary's exemption from new US sanctions on Russian oil
item.description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orbán plans to persuade U.S. President Donald Trump to exempt Hungary from new U.S. sanctions on Russian oil when he visits Washington next week.
item.dc:creator: Justin Spike, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: China's Xi promises to protect free trade at APEC as Trump snubs major summit
item.description: Trump left the country a day earlier after reaching deals with Xi meant to ease their escalating trade war.
item.dc:creator: HYUNG-JIN KIM, KIM TONG-HYUNG and HUIZHONG WU, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Security forces and protesters clash following disputed election in Tanzania; UN says 10 dead
item.description: Protests in Tanzania have entered their third day as the electoral body continues to announce the results of an election that sparked deadly demonstrations, leading to the government’s shutdown of the internet and the deployment of the military.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Rio favelas left reeling after lethal gang raid as families bury the dead
item.description: RIO DE JANEIRO (AP) — Families of the scores of people killed in a deadly gang raid by Rio de Janeiro police began burying the dead on Thursday, with residents left reeling by the scenes of carnage and livid at law enforcement whom they accuse of excessive force, torture and extrajudicial killings.
item.dc:creator: ELÉONORE HUGHES, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Serbia youth lead thousands on march for weekend rally marking deadly canopy collapse last year
item.description: BELGRADE, Serbia (AP) — Thousands of mainly young people in Serbia embarked on a two-day march from Belgrade on Thursday, aiming to join a major rally in the country's north this weekend that will mark the anniversary of a deadly train station disaster.
item.dc:creator: JOVANA GEC, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Haiti, Jamaica and Cuba pick up the pieces after Melissa's destruction
item.description: SANTIAGO DE CUBA, Cuba (AP) — The rumble of large machinery, whine of chain saws and chopping of machetes echoed through communities across the northern Caribbean on Thursday as they dug out from the destruction of Hurricane Melissa and surveyed the damage left behind.
item.dc:creator: ARIEL FERNÁNDEZ, ANDREA RODRÍGUEZ and JOHN MYERS JR., Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Death toll from Rio de Janeiro police raid on drug gang rises to 121
item.description: RIO DE JANEIRO (AP) — The death toll in a massive police raid targeting a drug trafficking gang in Rio de Janeiro rose to at least 121 people, authorities said Thursday.
item.dc:creator: ELÉONORE HUGHES and GABRIELA SÁ PESSOA, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: King Charles strips Andrew of 'prince' title, evicts him
item.description: The royal family has been under pressure from the public to strip Andrew of his titles because of his association with Jeffrey Epstein.
item.dc:creator: Steph Whiteside, NewsNation

item.title: Prince Andrew dragged out negotiations before banishment for cash: Source
item.description: Asked if there was a “number” Andrew had in mind, the source said, “I think a couple of million would go a long way.
item.dc:creator: Paula Froelich, NewsNation

item.title: Trump seeks energy deal with China amid broader trade talks
item.description: President Trump is eyeing an energy deal with China, he said in a social media post Thursday. He said in a post on Truth Social that Beijing has agreed to begin purchasing U.S. energy and that a “very large scale transaction” related to oil and gas from Alaska "may take place.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Frazin, The Hill

item.title: What Israel's deadly strikes in Gaza, and Trump's response, reveal about the ceasefire
item.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — Israel’s intense bombardment of the Gaza Strip this week marked the most serious challenge yet for a fragile, U.S.-brokered ceasefire deal. Over 100 Palestinians were killed, including dozens of civilians, according to Gaza health officials.
item.dc:creator: JULIA FRANKEL, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Barcelona's Sagrada Familia becomes the world's tallest church
item.description: BARCELONA, Spain (AP) — Barcelona’s Sagrada Familia basilica became the world’s tallest church on Thursday after a part of its central tower was lifted into place. The masterwork of architect Antoni Gaudí now rises to 162.91 meters (534 feet) above the city, the church said in a statement.
item.dc:creator: JOSEPH WILSON, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Outrage as Swedish court refuses to deport convicted rapist, PM promises crackdown
item.description: Swedish court sparks outrage by refusing to deport convicted rapist, citing crime wasn't 'exceptionally grave.' PM promises toughest Nordic deportation laws.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Five more arrested in Louvre heist investigation as stolen crown jewels worth $102M still missing
item.description: Five more arrests made in Louvre heist investigation as French crown jewels worth $102 million remain missing after daring daytime theft from Paris museum.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Hegseth announces new strike on alleged narco-trafficking boat, killing 4
item.description: The military campaign comes as the U.S. has turned up pressure against Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro.
item.dc:creator: Filip Timotija, NewsNation

item.title: 5 more arrests made in Louvre jewel heist
item.description: It took thieves less than eight minutes to steal the jewels valued at $102 million. The treasures remain missing.
item.dc:creator: ANGELA CHARLTON and THOMAS ADAMSON, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Pakistan threatens to 'obliterate' Taliban after peace talks fall apart
item.description: Pakistan threatened to "obliterate" the Taliban after peace talks toward lasting peace between the two sides failed following deadly border clashes.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: As Trump meets Xi, Republicans push for release of detained Americans
item.description: The meeting between Trump and Xi in South Korea is largely focused on coming to a ceasefire in an escalating trade war.
item.dc:creator: Laura Kelly, NewsNation

item.title: Frontlines with Robert Sherman: All eyes on China, US relationship
item.description: The two heads of state representing the two most powerful economies in the world are set to meet face-to-face within the next few hours.
item.dc:creator: Robert Sherman, NewsNation

item.title: 80-year-old Australian woman dies on island after cruise ship leaves without her
item.description: An 80-year-old Australian woman was found dead after the Coral Adventurer cruise ship allegedly left her behind on Lizard Island during a hiking tour.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Mexican president disagrees with US revoking 13 Mexican airline routes
item.description: Sheinbaum added she will meet with Mexican airlines on Friday to gain insight into their perspective on the matter.
item.dc:creator: Raul Cortes, Natalia Siniawski, Franklin Paul, NewsNation

item.title: Putin says Russia's nuclear-armed underwater drone was tested successfully
item.description: MOSCOW (AP) — Russia has conducted a successful test of a new atomic-powered and nuclear-capable underwater drone, President Vladimir Putin said Wednesday, declaring that the new weapon can't be intercepted.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: No date to let Mexican cattle into US as work on sterile flies continues
item.description: Mexican Agriculture Minister Julio Berdegue said on Wednesday that Mexico and the United States have not yet set a date to resume Mexican cattle exports amid an outbreak of the flesh-eating screwworm parasite.
item.dc:creator: NewsNation

item.title: New Jersey man's Titanic belongings recovered expected to auction for more than $100K
item.description: Frederick Sutton's Titanic personal effects, including gold watch and first-class passenger list, remain in family hands for over a century before auction.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Trump extends friendly hand to Xi in fraught relationship with China
item.description: Friday's meeting marks the first time the two leaders have seen each other face-to-face in six years.
item.dc:creator: Laura Kelly, NewsNation

item.title: Hamas victim memorial featuring Shiri Bibas and sons targeted by vandals in Milan, Italy
item.description: Artist AleXsandro Palombo calls the defacement of his Bibas family memorial mural in Milan an antisemitic act disguised as activism rather than legitimate protest.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Category 5 Hurricane Melissa brings flooding and catastrophic winds to Jamaica
item.description: KINGSTON, Jamaica (AP) — Heavy floodwaters swept across southwestern Jamaica, winds tore roofs off buildings and boulders tumbled onto roads Tuesday as Hurricane Melissa pummeled the Caribbean island as a catastrophic Category 5 storm, one of the strongest Atlantic hurricanes on record.
item.dc:creator: DÁNICA COTO and JOHN MYERS JR., Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Here's how tariffs could impact holiday shopping season: Analysis
item.description: If current tariffs had been in place last year, consumers would have faced a $28.6 billion burden, a new analysis finds.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Dorn, NewsNation

item.title: Photos as Hurricane Melissa makes landfall as Category 5 storm
item.description: "Don't bet against Melissa because you will lose," warned Jamaican Government Minister Desmond McKenzie.
item.dc:creator: Sean Noone, NewsNation

item.title: Video: Hurricane Hunters inside Melissa's eye
item.description: The Hunters wrote on social media Tuesday that they were forced to turn back from another mission into the eye of Melissa due to "heavy turbulence.
item.dc:creator: Zach Kaplan, NewsNation

item.title: Ukraine's long-range strikes cut Russia's oil refining capacity by 20%, Zelenskyy says
item.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Ukraine’s long-range strikes on refineries inside Russia have reduced Moscow’s oil refining capacity by 20%, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said, citing intelligence from Western governments.
item.dc:creator: SAMYA KULLAB, Associated Press, WGN 9
